p: An independent-samples Kruskal-Wallis test did not reveal any differences between groups in the choice-RT task ( H = 3.56, p = 0.17) or in the Simon task ( H = 0.55, p = 0.76). The median for correct responses in the choice-RT task was 19.75 (out of 20), with a range of 18.25–20, and the average success was 98%. The median for correct responses in the Simon task was 18.63, with a range of 12.13–20, and the average success was 92%.
